DataElement.preferredName: Procedure Domain Surgery Resection Extent Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indication of the extent of tumor removed during a surgical procedure.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to procedure._The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures._The surgical removal of an organ or a part of an organ._The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to procedure.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to procedure.

Property.preferredDefinition: The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.:The surgical removal of an organ or a part of an organ.:The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.

Concepts.definition: The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.
The surgical removal of an organ or a part of an organ.
The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of an entire visible lesion, with no obvious lesion detected on post-operative evaluation; microscopic residual disease may be present.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of an entire visible lesion, with no obvious lesion detected on post-operative evaluation; microscopic residual disease may be present.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not whole; lacking some necessary part or detail; unfinished.: The surgical removal of an organ or a part of an organ.

Concepts.definition: Not whole; lacking some necessary part or detail; unfinished.
The surgical removal of an organ or a part of an organ.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of or belonging to a restricted area or locality.: To come back or to return.: The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ.

Concepts.definition: Of or belonging to a restricted area or locality.
Happening again (especially at regular intervals).
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery to remove one or more metastases (tumors formed from cells that have spread from the primary tumor). When all metastases are removed, it is called a complete metastasectomy.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of metastases.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.: The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ.

Concepts.definition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer cells that remain after attempts to remove the cancer have been made.

Concepts.definition: Tumor cells that remain in the body following cancer treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure for the removal of multiple tumors within a single operative procedure.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure for the removal of multiple tumors within a single operative procedure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not quite or just short of.: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.: The surgical removal of an organ or a part of an organ.

Concepts.definition: Not quite or just short of.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.
The surgical removal of an organ or a part of an organ.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: 51 to 89 percent resection, moderate radiographic residual tumor

Being below an optimal level or standard.: The surgical removal of as much of a malignant tumor as is reasonably possible. This procedure increases the effectiveness of the subsequent administration of chemotherapy and/or radiation therapy.: The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.

Concepts.definition: Being below an optimal level or standard.
The surgical removal of as much of a malignant tumor as is reasonably possible. This procedure increases the effectiveness of the subsequent administration of chemotherapy and/or radiation therapy.
The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: 10-50% resection, significant radiographic residual tumor

The best or most suitable; the greatest degree attainable.: The surgical removal of as much of a malignant tumor as is reasonably possible. This procedure increases the effectiveness of the subsequent administration of chemotherapy and/or radiation therapy.: The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.

Concepts.definition: The best or most suitable; the greatest degree attainable.
The surgical removal of as much of a malignant tumor as is reasonably possible. This procedure increases the effectiveness of the subsequent administration of chemotherapy and/or radiation therapy.
The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Large in quantity, range, or spatial extent.: The total of part of a series of numbers.: The surgical removal of an organ or a part of an organ.

Concepts.definition: Large in quantity, range, or spatial extent.
The total of part of a series of numbers.
The surgical removal of an organ or a part of an organ.
